```{r}

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
source("../utility_scripts/plotting_help.R")
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| include: true
#| label: example_figure_saving

fake_db <- data.frame(colA = c(1,3,5,2,8,10,6), colB = c(2.2, 4.6, 12, 4.2, 14, 21, 10))

ggplot(fake_db, aes(x = colA, y = colB)) +
  geom_point(size = 3, color = "steelblue") +
  theme_classic()

#Note I set save_date = T when I am playing around with the data so I have snapshots of figures as I work on them over time.  Once an analysis has matured I typically try to turn this off. 
save_figures("example_figure", save_date =T)

```
